name: Triple nesting of objects
instruction:
Write a function `tripleNestedObject` that takes one parameter: `param`. The parameter is any value.

An example will help you understand what you need to do:

```javascript
tripleNestedObject(5); // { first: { second: { third: { param: 5 } } } }
tripleNestedObject('hello'); // { first: { second: { third: { param: 'hello' } } } }
```

The function should return an object that has three nested properties `first`, ``second`, `third`. Each of these properties must be an object.
